questions.question: What does a red traffic light signal mean?
questions.explanation: A red light signal means you must stop before entering the crosswalk or intersection.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers of potential hazards on the road.

questions.question: What does a green arrow signal indicate?
questions.explanation: A green arrow signal means you have the right-of-way and may proceed in the direction the arrow points.

questions.question: What does a 'No U-Turn' sign look like?
options: Red circle with a red slash over a U-turn symbol
Yellow diamond with two arrows pointing left
Blue square with a white U-turn symbol
Red octagon with the words 'NO U-TURN'
questions.correctAnswer: Red circle with a red slash over a U-turn symbol
questions.explanation: A 'No U-Turn' sign is a red circle with a red slash over a U-turn symbol.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow light signal mean?
options: Slow down and proceed with caution
questions.correctAnswer: Slow down and proceed with caution
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light signal means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When two drivers arrive at an intersection without traffic signs or signals at the same time, who has the right of way?
options: The driver with the largest vehicle
questions.explanation: When two drivers arrive at an intersection without traffic signs or signals at the same time, the driver on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: Who has the right of way at a four-way stop?
options: The driver with the largest vehicle
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the driver who arrives first has the right of way.

questions.question: When merging onto a freeway, who has the right of way?
options: The driver in the right lane of the freeway
The driver in the left lane of the freeway
The driver with the largest vehicle
questions.correctAnswer: The driver in the right lane of the freeway
questions.explanation: When merging onto a freeway, the driver already on the freeway in the right lane has the right of way.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on rural interstate highways in Idaho?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on rural interstate highways in Idaho is 80 mph.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit in a residential area in Idaho unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit in a residential area in Idaho unless otherwise posted is 25 mph.

questions.question: When can you park in a handicapped parking space?
options: When the parking lot is full
When you have a valid handicapped parking permit
questions.correctAnswer: When you have a valid handicapped parking permit
questions.explanation: You can park in a handicapped parking space only if you have a valid handicapped parking permit.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use:
questions.explanation: When driving in fog, you should use your low beam headlights to increase visibility.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to hydroplane?
options: Steer in the direction you want to go
Ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go
questions.correctAnswer: Ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, you should ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go.

questions.question: In Idaho, it is illegal to follow an emergency vehicle responding to a call closer than:
questions.explanation: In Idaho, it is illegal to follow an emergency vehicle responding to a call closer than 500 feet.

questions.question: What should you do if you encounter an aggressive driver?
options: Ignore them and keep your distance
questions.correctAnswer: Ignore them and keep your distance
questions.explanation: If you encounter an aggressive driver, you should ignore them and keep your distance to ensure your own safety.
